result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent P. Mangiaracina was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent P. Mangiaracina is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vincent P. Mangiaracina was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Vincent P. Mangiaracina was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 3 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Shall not possess, purchase, carry or transport any weapons or ammunition.  Successfully complete Behavioral Treatment Court.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  CONCURRENT to 14CF1000.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1 - DE is sentenced to 3 1/2 years in the WSP; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision. Sentence is concurrent to Count 3 and 14CF1000.
Count 3 - DE is sentenced to 2 years in the WSP; 1 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision and concurrent to Count 1 as well as 14CF1000.  
Credit for 265 days in this case.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights given.
field by Agt. Charles Sosinski
